snippet: The engineer who was driving the train that derailed in Philadelphia “has absolutely no recollection of the incident or anything unusual,” his lawyer said.
abstract: Federal investigation of Amtrak derailment cites new video analysis showing that train accelerated from 70 to 100 miles per hour less than a minute before it entered fatal curve; also finds train's engineer, who has been identified as Brandon Bostian, has agreed to be interviewed by investigators.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG, MATT FLEGENHEIMER and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA
byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg reported from Philadelphia, and Matt Flegenheimer and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Patrick McGeehan contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The engineer who was driving the train that derailed in Philadelphia “has absolutely no recollection of the incident or anything unusual,” his lawyer said.

headline.main: Brandon Bostian Agrees to Talk About Amtrak Derailment but May Recall Little
headline.print_headline: Train Accelerated Fast, U.S. Investigators Say
